Middleware: Middleware functions are functions that have access to the request object (req), the response object (res), and the next function in the applicationâ€™s request-response cycle. Middleware functions can perform various tasks, such as logging, authentication, parsing request bodies, etc.
app.use(): This method is used to mount middleware functions in the Express application. It takes a path and one or more middleware functions as arguments. When a request is made to the server, Express will match the request path with the path specified in app.use() and execute the middleware functions associated with that path.
